alert.note: Alert for Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 4:47PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Little River at GA 5 near Woodstock affecting Cherokee County. Etowah River Downstream I-575 at Canton affecting Cherokee County. Chattahoochee River at US 41 at Atlanta affecting Cobb and Fulton Counties. Nancy Creek at West Wesley Road at Atlanta affecting Fulton County. For the Etowah River Basin...including Landrum, Russell Creek downstream of Head Lake Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Matt, Ball Ground, Canton, Old GA 5 below Ball Ground, Canton, Canton, Waleska, Woodstock, Noonday Creek above Chastain Meadows Pkwy Marietta, Woodstock, Woodstock, Kennesaw, Acworth, Allatoona Dam above Cartersville, Rockmart, Cartersville, Dallas, Kingston, Kingston, Rome, Rome...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Helen, Dahlonega, Cornelia, Buford, Buford, Suwanee, Suwanee, Chattahoochee River upstream McGinnis Ferry Rd, Norcross, Chattahoochee River above Roswell, Roswell, Powers Ferry & I285 Atlanta, Smyrna, Chattahoochee River below Morgan Falls Dam, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Atlanta, Fairplay, Whitesburg, Fairburn, Whitesburg, Whitesburg, Franklin, Corinth, Hammett Rd below Hogansville, Franklin, West Point, Union, Columbus, Omaha...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Nancy Creek at West Wesley Road at Atlanta. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding of residential yards occurs along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on West Wesley Road. This includes Nancy Creek Road and Ridge Valley Court. Portions of The Westminster Schools athletic fields upstream from the gage will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 PM EST Wednesday was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.8 feet on 02/06/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
